blockContinueButton.description: Button text to continue to site

blockExplainAdware.message: Adware is a form of malicious software which displays unwanted advertising on your computer.

blockExplainCompromised.description: Text explaining what a compromised site is
blockExplainCompromised.message: Compromised sites (or servers) are otherwise legitimate sites that are being used by hackers without the owner's knowledge. Compromised sites are often used to house and spread malware.

blockExplainDefault.description: Text explaining a default block that has no specifics as above
blockExplainDefault.message: Possible suspicious activity encompasses a variety of behaviors that are commonly attributed to technical support scams, cryptojacking, browser hijacking, and other types of harmful, risky, and potentially unwanted objects.

blockExplainExploit.description: Text explaining what an exploit is
blockExplainExploit.message: Exploits are a type of malware that take advantage of bugs and vulnerabilities in a system in order to allow the exploit's creator to take control.

blockExplainFradulent.description: Text explaining what a fradulent site is
blockExplainFradulent.message: Fraudulent websites appear to be one thing, like a tech support site, a dating site, or a shopping site with illegal products or great deals, but they're really scams to try to steal your information or credit card details.

blockExplainHijack.description: Text explaining what a hijacker is
blockExplainHijack.message: A hijacker is a type of that malware that modifies a web browser's settings without users' permission, usually to inject unwanted ads into the browser or redirect to scam sites.

blockExplainMalvertising.message: Malvertising, or "malicious advertising," is the use of online advertising to distribute malware with little to no user interaction required.

blockExplainMalware.message: Malware, or "malicious software," is an umbrella term that refers to any malicious program or code that is harmful to systems.

blockExplainPharma.description: Text explaining what illegal pharma sites are
blockExplainPharma.message: Pharma is short for "pharmacy." In cybersecurity, the expression refers to spam or websites that traffic in fake or illegal medication. These sites may also sell legal medication, but in violation of local laws.

blockExplainPhishing.message: Phishing scams attempt to obtain your information by presenting themselves as legitimate websites, then asking for your password, credit card details, or other sensitive information.

blockExplainRansomware.message: Ransomware is a form of malware that locks you out of your device and/or encrypts your files, then forces you to pay a ransom to get them back.

blockExplainReputation.message: This website is suspected of being compromised or hosting a potential privacy or security threat.

blockExplainRiskware.message: Riskware, or "risky software," describes legitimate software programs that contain loopholes or vulnerabilities that can be exploited by hackers for malicious purposes.

blockExplainScam.message: Possible suspicious activity encompasses a variety of behaviors that are commonly attributed to technical support scams, cryptojacking, browser hijacking, and other types of harmful, risky, and potentially unwanted objects.

blockExplainSpam.message: Spam is an undesired communication, often an email or call, that gets sent out in bulk. Spam wastes time and resources, so many communication tools have built-in ways of minimizing it.

blockExplainSpyware.message: Spyware is a type of malware that gathers information on a device and sends it to a third-party actor or organization that wouldn't normally have access. In the past, this term was also used for adware and cookies.

blockExplainTrojan.description: Text explaining what a Trojan is
blockExplainTrojan.message: Trojans are programs that claim to perform one function but actually do another, typically malicious. Trojans can take the form of attachments, downloads, and fake videos/programs and, once active on a system, may do a number of things, including stealing sensitive data or taking control of the device.

blockExplainWorm.description: Text explaining what a Worm is
blockExplainWorm.message: Worms are a type of malware similar to viruses, but they do not need to be attached to another program in order to spread.

suspiciousContentExplanation.message: $mb$ scans downloads started in the browser and may block/remove the item if it looks suspicious. If you trust this content/site and would like to proceed, click "Continue".

suspiciousDownloadExplanation.description: Text explaining why a suspicious download block could occur
suspiciousDownloadExplanation.message: $mb$ blocks downloads that either come from websites that see relatively light traffic or may contain potentially malicious content. This is intended to protect you from new $type$. However, if you trust content from this site and would like to proceed, click "Continue".

suspiciousTldExplanation.description: Text explaining why a suspicious TLD block could occur
suspiciousTldExplanation.message: $mb$ blocked this page because it uses a suspicious top level domain (TLD). These are frequently used by scam or phishing sites, but can be used by legitimate websites as well. If you trust this website, please click CONTINUE TO SITE. Otherwise, choose GO BACK.

systemPage.description: Shown as a title when the user is on a system page

telemOptInLabel.description: Directly visible text to convince users to opt in to telemetry
telemOptInLabel.message: Help us make things even better by anonymously sharing detection and device data with $mb$

telemOptInTooltip.description: Tooltip for when user hovers over visible opt in text
telemOptInTooltip.message: We collect data anonymously whenever a threat is detected or blocked. It helps us create a better user experience and it makes our products better at fighting malware.

upSellSummaryText.message: Cyberthreats don't stop at your browser. Check out the status of your protection on this device — in the browser and beyond.

urlColumnAllowList.description: Column Header for Allow List URL/IP Addresses

urlColumnContentControl.description: Column Header for Content Control URL/IP Addresses

vpnFreeInstallDescription.description: VPN description status when mbam is not premium.
vpnFreeInstallDescription.message: Secure your WiFi connection and protect your online privacy with our no-log VPN.

vpnFreeInstallStatus.description: VPN card text when mabam is not premium.

vpnFreeIntallTooltip.message: Malwarebytes free scanner is installed. Upgrade to Premium for complete protection.

vpnInstalledStatusDescription.message: Nice work! Your WiFi connection and online privacy are protected.

vpnNotInstalledDescription.message: Secure your WiFi connection and protect your online privacy with our no-log VPN.

vpnNotInstalledStatus.description: Status text when mbam is not installed yet.

vpnNotInstalledTooltipTxt.description: Vpn protection card info tooltip text.
vpnNotInstalledTooltipTxt.message: Browser Guard not linked to Malwarebytes VPN on this device

websiteBlockHeader.description: Header at top right before indicating block type

websiteBlockText.description: Text right before noting what site was blocked

webstorePage.description: Shown as a title when the user is on the Chrome Webstore

welcomeChrome.description: Tells user to keep Browser Guard extension icon pinned to address bar
welcomeChrome.message: Keep $name$ pinned to your address bar

welcomeChromeInfo.description: More info on pinning the extension
welcomeChromeInfo.message: (Click the puzzle icon, then click the pin icon)

welcomeDefault.message: Click on the Malwarebytes icon in your address bar to opt in to data sharing and help us create a malware-free existence.

welcomeDone.description: Final line telling user setup is done
welcomeDone.message: Done! Get ready for a safer, faster browsing experience.

welcomeEdge.description: Tells edge user to keep Browser Guard extension icon pinned to address bar
welcomeEdge.message: Keep $name$ visible in your address bar

welcomeEdgeInfo.description: More info on pinning the extension
welcomeEdgeInfo.message: (Click the puzzle icon, then click the eye icon)

welcomeHeaderAction.description: Welcome header on welcome pages with user action (telemetry opt-in, pin Browser Guard etc.)

welcomeIconInfo.description: Info on how to use the Malwarebytes icon
welcomeIconInfo.message: Click the Malwarebytes icon to turn protection on or off at any time.

welcomePinEdgeInfo1.description: Tells user to keep Browser Guard extension icon pinned to Edge address bar.
welcomePinEdgeInfo1.message: Keep Malwarebytes Browser Guard shown in toolbar. Click the

welcomePinEdgeInfo2.message: puzzle icon, then click the eye icon.

welcomePinInfo1.message: Keep Malwarebytes Browser Guard pinned to your address bar.

welcomePinInfo2.description: Tells user to keep Browser Guard extension icon pinned to address bar
welcomePinInfo2.message: Click the puzzle icon, then click the pin icon.

welcomePinInfoFirefox1.message: Keep Malwarebytes Browser Guard pinned to your address bar.
